intro: Sericandra lophantha, commonly known as the woolly sericandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are broad, lobed, and covered in a dense, white, woolly hair that gives it its common name. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
